Package camzup.core

Class Transform2

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Transform2
All Implemented Interfaces:
IOriented2, ISpatial2, IVolume, IVolume2, Comparable<Transform2>
public class Transform2 extends Object implements Comparable<Transform2>, ISpatial2, IOriented2, IVolume2
Facilitates 2D affine transformations for entities.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Transform2.Easing
    An easing function to facilitate animating multiple transforms.

    • lookAt

      public Transform2 lookAt(Vec2 point, float step, Handedness handedness)
      Orients the transform to look at a target point. If the distance between the target and the transform's location is zero, resets the transform. Uses unclamped linear interpolation given a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] . The result is then normalized.
      Parameters:
      point - the target point
      step - the step
      handedness - the handedness
      Returns:
      this transform
      See Also:
      • Vec2.forward(Vec2)
      • Vec2.headingSigned(Vec2)
      • Vec2.none(Vec2)
      • Vec2.normalize(Vec2, Vec2)
      • Vec2.perpendicularCCW(Vec2, Vec2)
      • Vec2.perpendicularCW(Vec2, Vec2)
      • Vec2.right(Vec2)
      • Vec2.sub(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • moveByLocal

      public Transform2 moveByLocal(Vec2 dir)
      Moves the transform by a direction rotated according to the transform's rotation. Uses the formula:

      move ( dir ) := location + rotation * direction
      Parameters:
      dir - the direction
      Returns:
      this transform
      See Also:
      • Vec2.add(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)
      • Vec2.hadamard(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)
      • Vec2.rotateZ(Vec2, float, float, Vec2)

    • setAxes

      public Transform2 setAxes(float xRight, float yForward, float yRight, float xForward)
      A helper function to set the transform's from either separate vectors or from the columns of a matrix. The transform's location and scale remain unchanged.
      Parameters:
      xRight - m00 : right x
      yForward - m11 : forward y
      yRight - m10 : right y
      xForward - m01 : forward x
      Returns:
      the transform
      See Also:
      • Vec2.headingSigned(Vec2)
      • Vec2.normalize(Vec2, Vec2)

    • setAxes

      public Transform2 setAxes(Vec2 right, Vec2 forward)
      Sets a transform's rotation to the given axes. The transform's location and scale remain unchanged.
      Parameters:
      right - the right axis
      forward - the forward axis
      Returns:
      the transform

      ub - the upper bound

    • fromAxes

      public static Transform2 fromAxes(float xRight, float yForward, float yRight, float xForward, Transform2 target)
      A helper function to set the transform's from either separate vectors or from the columns of a matrix. The transform's translation is set to zero; its scale, to one.
      Parameters:
      xRight - m00 : right x
      yForward - m11 : forward y
      yRight - m10 : right y
      xForward - m01 : forward x
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform
      See Also:
      • Vec2.headingSigned(Vec2)
      • Vec2.normalize(Vec2, Vec2)
      • Vec2.one(Vec2)
      • Vec2.zero(Vec2)

    • fromAxes

      public static Transform2 fromAxes(Vec2 right, Vec2 forward, Transform2 target)
      Creates a transform from axes. The transform's translation is set to zero; its scale, to one.
      Parameters:
      right - the right axis
      forward - the forward axis
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform

    • fromDir

      public static Transform2 fromDir(Ray2 ray, Handedness handedness, Transform2 target)
      Creates a transform from a ray. The transform's translation is set to the ray's origin; its scale, to one.
      Parameters:
      ray - the direction
      handedness - the handedness
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform
      See Also:
      • fromDir(Vec2, Handedness, Transform2)
      • moveTo(Vec2)

    • fromDir

      public static Transform2 fromDir(Vec2 dir, Handedness handedness, Transform2 target)
      Creates a transform from a direction. The transform's translation is set to zero; its scale, to one.
      Parameters:
      dir - the direction
      handedness - the handedness
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform
      See Also:
      • Vec2.forward(Vec2)
      • Vec2.headingSigned(Vec2)
      • Vec2.none(Vec2)
      • Vec2.normalize(Vec2, Vec2)
      • Vec2.one(Vec2)
      • Vec2.perpendicularCW(Vec2, Vec2)
      • Vec2.right(Vec2)
      • Vec2.zero(Vec2)

      Sets a transform to the identity.

      Returns:
      the identity
      See Also:

    • invMulDir

      public static Vec2 invMulDir(Transform2 t, Vec2 source, Vec2 target)
      Multiplies a direction by a transform's inverse. This rotates the direction by the transform's negative angle.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      source - the input direction
      target - the output direction
      Returns:
      the direction
      See Also:
      • Vec2.rotateZ(Vec2, float, Vec2)

    • invMulPoint

      public static Vec2 invMulPoint(Transform2 t, Vec2 source, Vec2 target)
      Multiplies a point by a transform's inverse. This subtracts the translation from the point, divides the point by the scale, then rotates by the negative angle.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      source - the input point
      target - the output point
      Returns:
      the point
      See Also:
      • Vec2.div(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)
      • Vec2.rotateZ(Vec2, float, Vec2)
      • Vec2.sub(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • invMulVector

      public static Vec2 invMulVector(Transform2 t, Vec2 source, Vec2 target)
      Multiplies a vector by a transform's inverse. This divides the vector by the scale, then rotates by the negative angle.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      source - the input point
      target - the output point
      Returns:
      the vector
      See Also:
      • Vec2.div(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)
      • Vec2.rotateZ(Vec2, float, Vec2)

    • mulCurveSeg

      public static Vec2 mulCurveSeg(Transform2 t, Vec2 fhSrc, Vec2 rhSrc, Vec2 coSrc, Vec2 fhTrg, Vec2 rhTrg, Vec2 coTrg)
      Multiplies a curve segment by a transform. A convenience for drawing curves in a renderer. The segment is represented by the first control point, second control point and destination anchor point.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      fhSrc - the source fore handle
      rhSrc - the source rear handle
      coSrc - the source coordinate
      fhTrg - the target fore handle
      rhTrg - the target rear handle
      coTrg - the target coordinate
      Returns:
      the transformed coordinate

    • mulDir

      public static Vec2 mulDir(Transform2 t, Vec2 source, Vec2 target)
      Multiplies a direction by a transform. This rotates the direction by the transform's rotation.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      source - the input direction
      target - the output direction
      Returns:
      the direction
      See Also:
      • Vec2.rotateZ(Vec2, float, Vec2)

    • mulPoint

      public static Vec2 mulPoint(Transform2 t, Vec2 source, Vec2 target)
      Multiplies a point by a transform. This rotates the point, multiplies the point by the scale, then adds the translation.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      source - the input point
      target - the output point
      Returns:
      the point

    • mulVector

      public static Vec2 mulVector(Transform2 t, Vec2 source, Vec2 target)
      Multiplies a vector by a transform. This rotates the vector by the transform's rotation and then multiplies it by the transform's scale.
      Parameters:
      t - the transform
      source - the input vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the vector

    • random

      public static Transform2 random(Random rng, float lbLoc, float ubLoc, float lbRot, float ubRot, float lbScl, float ubScl, Transform2 target)
      Creates a random transform. Uses Vec2.randomCartesian(java.util.Random, float, float, Vec2) for location and scale.
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      lbLoc - the location lower bound
      ubLoc - the location upper bound
      lbRot - the rotation lower bound
      ubRot - the rotation upper bound
      lbScl - the scale lower bound
      ubScl - the scale upper bound
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the random transform
      See Also:
      • Vec2.randomCartesian(java.util.Random, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • random

      public static Transform2 random(Random rng, Transform2 target)
      Creates a random transform. The location range is [-1.0f, 1.0f] . The scale range is [0.7071067690849304f, 1.4142136573791504f] .
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the random transform

    • random

      public static Transform2 random(Random rng, Vec2 lbLoc, Vec2 ubLoc, float lbRot, float ubRot, Vec2 lbScl, Vec2 ubScl, Transform2 target)
      Creates a random transform. Uses Vec2.randomCartesian(java.util.Random, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2) for location and scale.
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      lbLoc - the location lower bound
      ubLoc - the location upper bound
      lbRot - the rotation lower bound
      ubRot - the rotation upper bound
      lbScl - the scale lower bound
      ubScl - the scale upper bound
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the transform
      See Also:
      • Vec2.randomCartesian(java.util.Random, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)
